briefing.opening: Good morning/afternoon. I will now begin the climate briefing for January 18, 2026.

sections.title: ğŸ”´ Changes in Domestic Climate Disaster Patterns and Deepening Agricultural Damage
sections.content: Recently, analyses have suggested that climate change and an aging population are altering the landscape of disaster sites in Korea [1, 4, 32]. Specifically, an increasing trend in fire occurrences has been observed, while rescue and emergency medical services activities have decreased [1, 4, 32]. Furthermore, fire department dispatch data directly confirms the impact of abnormal weather, with a decrease in beehive removal activities and an increase in the transport of heat-related illness patients [2, 3, 5, 8, 10]. These climate changes are also severely impacting the agricultural sector, leading to an emergency situation in the Naju region where tomato blight damage, caused by abnormal weather, is spreading [9].

sections.title: ğŸŒ± Efforts by Domestic Local Governments and Corporations Towards Carbon Neutrality Goals
sections.content: Various local governments and institutions in Korea are making concrete efforts to achieve carbon neutrality. Chungcheongnam-do is accelerating the spread of green buildings to achieve its 2045 carbon neutrality goal [11, 16, 17, 19, 21, 23, 24], and Jinju City will embark on realizing carbon neutrality by launching a hydrogen vehicle dissemination project starting in 2026 [12, 18, 20]. Daejeon Seo-gu is holding a carbon neutrality practice apartment competition, and the Seoul Carbon Neutrality Experience Center is transforming into a venue for citizen action, thereby encouraging carbon neutrality in daily life [13, 14]. KEPCO KPS has also announced plans to focus this year's budget on carbon neutrality, alongside AI, safety, and regional cooperation [15, 22], indicating anticipated contributions at the corporate level.

sections.title: ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡· Accelerating Domestic Renewable Energy Transition and Policy Challenges
sections.content: In Korea, there is active movement to accelerate the renewable energy transition. A commitment has been expressed to lead the decarbonization transition and focus on expanding renewable energy and strengthening energy welfare [25], and a Climate and Energy Council for accelerating renewable energy has also been launched [29]. Hampyeong County is demonstrating the positive social effects of new and renewable energy by returning solar power generation profits to its residents [27, 30]. However, with the inauguration of the Korea Energy Agency's chairman, numerous pending issues that need to be addressed amidst renewable energy expansion have accumulated [26], and policy concerns are deepening, such as the issue of profit distribution raised in relation to the mandatory installation of solar panels in public parking lots [28].

sections.title: ğŸŒ Impacts of Climate Change on the International Community and the Duality of Response
sections.content: In the international community, extensive impacts of climate change are observed, alongside complex patterns of response efforts. European Winter Olympic venues are shrinking due to climate change [33], and ecosystem changes are accelerating, with sharks seeking habitat changes due to rising sea temperatures [41]. Notably, the cost of climate change on oceans is far greater than anticipated [35], and warnings suggest that the fate of the Earth's coastlines will be determined by the rate of Antarctic ice sheet melt [43]. Meanwhile, scientists are continuing research to unlock the secrets of climate change by mapping the terrain beneath Antarctic glaciers [36, 39], but news that Wall Street has turned its back on climate change efforts raises concerns about the financial market's commitment to climate action [37, 42]. Furthermore, amid international competition for energy transition, such as Japan gaining an early advantage in Uzbekistan's renewable energy market, the need for the Korean government to strengthen PPP support has also been raised [31].

briefing.closing: Today's briefing highlights the direct impacts of climate change on disaster patterns and ecosystems both domestically and internationally, as well as the persistent financial and policy challenges that remain amidst ongoing global efforts towards carbon neutrality and renewable energy transition. This concludes today's climate briefing.

articles.description: Last year, fire incidents increased due to climate change, while fire rescue activities significantly decreased. A significant portion of fire rescue activities involves beehive removal. With deepening low birth rates and an aging population, more than half of the emergency patients transported last year were elderly individuals aged 60 or older. According to the 2025 performance data released by the National Fire Agency on the 18th, the total number of fire, rescue, and emergency medical dispatches last year was recorded at 4,520,501. This...
